sentences: Marcus Braveboy (born May 9, 1985) better known by his stage name Braveboy (former stage name Mark Hardy) is a singer, songwriter born and raised in Trinidad and Tobago.

After completing his LLB (law), he started into a solo career and his first single "Lyrical Apology" produced by Giandre "The Phoenix" Diaz, won Fresh Track Of The Year 2010 on Heartstopper 91.3FM in Newark, Delaware (He was the only Non-American in the category).

In 2013, he partnered with Trinidadian rapper Yung Rudd and producer Mevon Soodeen of Xplicit Entertainment to create a fusion of Trap music and Soca called Trapso, which birthed hits such as "PUMPIN", "NAH BOY", "WUZ D SCENE" an “IZAHTRINI" and also won People's Choice at the Trinidad and Tobago, The Copyright Music Organisation of Trinidad and Tobago (COTT) Awards in 2015.
In 2020, during the COVID-19 pandemic, Braveboy hosted the "We Inside" concert series produced by the Trinidad and Tobago government's MusicTT, alongside frequent collaborator Stef Kalloo
In 2021 Braveboy is set to release his EP Braveboy Meets World, which will include the single "AfribbeanGyal" featuring Nigerian singer Dell Fire.
